taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Generic name Hemizonia and Latin - ella , diminutive]

bio:treatment.discussion: Hemizonella is treated as distinct from Madia based on morphologic, cytologic, and molecular evidence (S. Carlquist et al. 2003). Unlike members of Madia, Hemizonella has obcompressed ray cypselae and hairy (ray and disc) fruits. D. D. Keck (1949) suggested that a somatic count of 2n = 32 for H. minima was evidence for a close relationship between Hemizonella and the morphologically similar Madia exigua (2n = 32). Keck’s count contrasts with a subsequent meiotic count of 2n = 21–22 II for H. minima. Hemizonella was resolved as the sister-group of Kyhosia in a phylogenetic analysis of nuclear ribosomal DNA (B. G. Baldwin 1996). The molecular data and morphologic resemblance of Hemizonella to M. exigua are consistent with the possibility that Hemizonella may be an ancient allopolyploid descended from a hybrid between ancestors with n = 6 (like Kyhosia) and n = 16 (like M. exigua).

references.reference: Keck, D. D. 1949. Hemizonella becomes a Madia. Madroño 10: 22.
